name: SpellShock Prototype
description:
This is an early prototype that aspires to be a game with systemic approach to spellcasting that serves for exploration and combat in first person relying on different system interactions and player quick thinking.

At the moment it is very barebones, buggy and the overall game feel is bad but I am curious to see if players make the right connections to get through the tutorial without feeling like there is weird design decisions in the way. Besides the tutorial there is something I called "sandbox area" which is just the room used for testing stuff where other weapons are unlocked.

Keep in mind  that this is a very early version of a proof of concept and in the future almost everything will be massively different or at least polished.

And these are my twitter and tumblr if you want to follow closely the development process.
